title: Bootstrap Typography
subject: Bootstrap
theory:
## Text Styling
Bootstrap sets basic global display, typography, and link styles.

### Defaults
* Font: System UI fonts (Apple, Segoe UI, Roboto...).
* Size: 1rem (usually 16px).

### Headings
Standard `<h1>` to `<h6>` are styled. You can also use classes `.h1` through `.h6` on non-heading tags.

### Display Headings
For headings that stand out more than normal headers (larger, lighter weight).
Classes: `.display-1` (Huge) to `.display-6`.

examples.explanation: Used for intro text in articles or hero sections.

interview_questions.question: Difference between small tag and .small class?
interview_questions.answer: Visually they are the same in Bootstrap (85% font size). The tag has semantic meaning; the class is purely visual.

real_world_use_cases.description: Use `.display-3` for the main hook to grab attention.

summary: Bootstrap provides clean, readable typography defaults immediately upon inclusion.
